subject: Re: [junit] Re: Methods that does not return value
msgSnippet: ... Wow. Thanks, Rick, for that exceptionally practical insight. Sometimes we can t see the forest for the trees. Since I haven t used VAJ since early 2001, I
messageBody:
>So said Rick Berman on 2003-06-19 --------------------
>However, I'll venture a suggestion that may make your
>life better. When inVAJava() returns true, the UI
>doesn't even give you a choice to use the reloading
>class loader. Please make sure that the "Reload
>classes every run" checkbox is *not* checked and see
>if that makes things run correctly for you. Again,
>I've only peeked at the code but it looks to me like
>unchecking that option is what inVAJava() returning
>true forces to be the case.

Wow.

Thanks, Rick, for that exceptionally practical insight. Sometimes we can't see the forest for the trees. Since I haven't used VAJ since early 2001, I would never have made the connection.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
